answers.answer: This may be syndrome X which is anginal pain with normal epicardial coronaries and I would suggest medical therapy with aspirin beta blockers, long acting nitrates and statins. Control of other risk factors is also very important, such as diabetes or hypertension, and loss of weight is metabolic syndrome is present.

question: Symptoms: pain in left jaw radiating down arm and into head, chest pressure. No dizziness. Occurred while sitting on couch. 56yo female. 2 prior episodes - one identical; one just chest pain. No problem ever during heavy exercise. No nauseu, no vomiting, mild weakness on left side which passed in 15 minutes. Hospital ran EKG which was mildly irregular, CAT scan which was normal (no blood clots), Cardiac Cath (no blockage), and blood tests (no signs of heart attack). No cause found. Patient is only taking Evista for osteopedia. High cholesterol. Arthritis in back. No other problems. Any suggestions or ideas as to what to look for? Hospital released patient without finding anything. Will take records to another doc but need to know what to ask.
title: Abnormal EKG, normal cardiac cath and CAT Scan
